intro: Asarina lobelii, commonly known as the Lobel's asarina, is a rare and unique flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its delicate, nodding flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a hairy texture. Asarina lobelii is adapted to high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions with well-drained soil.
